871, "english mk translation": "Enmity is contrary to virtue and should not be treated lightly, even as a game."},{"kural number": 872, "english mk translation": "One can make enemies of warriors with weapons, but not of eloquent scholars."},{"kural number": 873, "english mk translation": "One who seeks enmity from many while standing alone is more foolish than arrogant."},{"kural number": 874, "english mk translation": "The world will praise those who befriend even their enemies."},{"kural number": 875, "english mk translation": "If an enemy is divided into two factions and one is alone, they should seek alliance with one of the factions."},{"kural number": 876, "english mk translation": "Even if the enemy's intentions are unclear, when adversity strikes, it is best to maintain a semblance of friendship without getting too close, and without completely severing ties."},{"kural number": 877, "english mk translation": "Do not tell friends about your suffering, as they may not understand; do not reveal your weaknesses to enemies."},{"kural number": 878, "english mk translation": "The arrogance of enemies will be subdued before one who understands strategy, strengthens themselves, and takes precautions."},{"kural number": 879, "english mk translation": "Just as a thorny bush should be pruned when young, enmity should be eliminated before it grows."},{"kural number": 880, "english mk translation": "Those who cannot crush the arrogance of their enemies cannot truly claim to be alive."},{"kural number": 881, "english mk translation": "Just as shade and water can be harmful if they are deceptive, internal enmity from relatives is dangerous."},{"kural number": 882, "english mk translation": "One should be more wary of those who pretend to be friends but harbor internal enmity than of open enemies."},{"kural number": 883, "english mk translation": "One must guard against internal enmity; otherwise, it will destroy like a tool that cuts green bamboo during a crisis."},{"kural number": 884, "english mk translation": "If internal enmity becomes so ingrained that one cannot change their heart, it will turn even their own associates into enemies."},{"kural number": 885, "english mk translation": "Internal enmity among close relatives causes many sufferings that lead to ruin."},{"kural number": 886, "english mk translation": "It is extremely difficult to prevent the destruction caused by internal enmity among those who were once united."},{"kural number": 887, "english mk translation": "Just as a lid fits a box, outwardly appearing united, those with internal enmity are not truly aligned."},{"kural number": 888, "english mk translation": "Just as iron weakens when rubbed with abrasive, the strength of a lineage with internal enmity diminishes."},{"kural number": 889, "english mk translation": "Even a tiny internal rift, like a crack in sesame, can cause great harm."},{"kural number": 890, "english mk translation": "Living together without unity of heart is like living with a snake in a small hut - constantly fearful."},{"kural number": 891, "english mk translation": "If one does not underestimate the capability of someone who can complete a task, it becomes the best protection."},{"kural number": 892, "english mk translation": "Disrespecting elders leads to unending great suffering."},{"kural number": 893, "english mk translation": "One who wishes to destroy themselves can insult those capable of destroying enemies without listening to anyone."},{"kural number": 894, "english mk translation": "Those who cannot endure minor suffering are inviting their own end when they confront those who can endure great suffering."},{"kural number": 895, "english mk translation": "Those who incur the wrath of a powerful kingdom cannot survive, no matter where they flee."},{"kural number": 896, "english mk translation": "One can survive even being surrounded by fire, but one who offends the powerful cannot escape."},{"kural number": 897, "english mk translation": "Even with immense wealth and luxurious living, all pleasures become useless before the anger of the noble."},{"kural number": 898, "english mk translation": "Those who try to undermine the greatness of mountains (metaphor for great people) will be utterly destroyed, even if they possess great wealth."},{"kural number": 899, "english mk translation": "If those with high principles and determination become angry, oppressive regimes will collapse."},{"kural number": 900, "english mk translation": "Even with unlimited resources and strong support, one cannot escape the anger of the truly noble."},{"kural number": 901, "english mk translation": "Those who embark on duties but prioritize household pleasures will not achieve great fame."},{"kural number": 902, "english mk translation": "One who abandons their principles for the sake of pursuing a woman will face shame."},{"kural number": 903, "english mk translation": "A husband who submits to a wife lacking virtue, instead of correcting her, will face shame in the presence of the virtuous."},{"kural number": 904, "english mk translation": "One who fears managing a household without enjoying its benefits will not act effectively."},{"kural number": 905, "english mk translation": "One who fears making mistakes in doing good will be cautious around a wife who prevents errors."},{"kural number": 906, "english mk translation": "Those who submit to wives who are beautiful but lack knowledge and virtue gain no true honor, even if they claim divinity."},{"kural number": 907, "english mk translation": "A woman's chastity is more honorable than a man's valor in clinging to her."},{"kural number": 908, "english mk translation": "Those captivated by a woman's beauty, losing their intellect, will neglect friends and good deeds."},{"kural number": 909, "english mk translation": "One cannot expect virtue or wisdom from men who are controlled by arrogant women."},{"kural number": 910, "english mk translation": "Those with determination and intellect will not waste their lives pursuing women."},{"kural number": 911, "english mk translation": "Those who are deceived by the sweet words of courtesans, who lack love and seek only profit, will ultimately suffer."},{"kural number": 912, "english mk translation": "Never trust the words of courtesans who speak strategically for profit."},{"kural number": 913, "english mk translation": "The embrace of courtesans, who feign love for money, is like embracing a corpse in a dark room."},{"kural number": 914, "english mk translation": "Wise individuals seeking virtue will consider the pleasure offered by courtesans, who seek only wealth, as ignoble."},{"kural number": 915, "english mk translation": "Those with natural and acquired knowledge will not indulge in the pleasures offered by courtesans."},{"kural number": 916, "english mk translation": "No honorable person will lean on the shoulders of ignoble women."},{"kural number": 917, "english mk translation": "Only those with weak minds will trust the embrace of courtesans who lack love and act only for self-interest."},{"kural number": 918, "english mk translation": "The infatuation of a fool with a deceitful courtesan is called 'Mohini Mayakkam' (bewitchment)."},{"kural number": 919, "english mk translation": "There is no difference between pursuing a courtesan and falling into the hell of suffering."},{"kural number": 920, "english mk translation": "Those who associate with deceitful courtesans, alcohol, and gambling will lose all the glory in life."},{"kural number": 921, "english mk translation": "Alcoholics lose their honor and are not feared by others."},{"kural number": 922, "english mk translation": "One should not drink alcohol; only those who do not wish to gain the respect of scholars may."},{"kural number": 923, "english mk translation": "If even a mother cannot tolerate her son's drunken state, how can others tolerate him?"},{"kural number": 924, "english mk translation": "Shame flees from those who are addicted to the disgraceful vice of drunkenness."},{"kural number": 925, "english mk translation": "Buying intoxicants to lose oneself is the height of foolishness."},{"kural number": 926, "english mk translation": "There is no difference between a drunkard and one who consumes poison; they are equally lifeless."},{"kural number": 927, "english mk translation": "Even if drunkards drink in secret, their swaying eyes will reveal their state, and people will mock them."},{"kural number": 928, "english mk translation": "A drunkard cannot deny their habit, as they will reveal the truth in their intoxication."},{"kural number": 929, "english mk translation": "Trying to reform a drunkard is like trying to find someone drowned in water by lighting a torch."},{"kural number": 930, "english mk translation": "Will a sober drunkard not reflect on the harm of drinking after seeing another drunkard stumble?"},{"kural number": 931, "english mk translation": "One should not gamble, even for the sake of victory; it is like fish swallowing the hook along with the bait."},{"kural number": 932, "english mk translation": "What good can come to gamblers who, in their joy of winning, embrace a hundred defeats?"},{"kural number": 933, "english mk translation": "One who habitually gambles away their possessions will lose both wealth and the means to earn it."},{"kural number": 934, "english mk translation": "There is no evil like gambling, which brings suffering, destroys fame, and leads to poverty."},{"kural number": 935, "english mk translation": "Those who are unwilling to give up gambling, its tools, and the effort involved will end up with nothing."},{"kural number": 936, "english mk translation": "Those trapped in the web of gambling will suffer endlessly, even losing the desire to eat."},{"kural number": 937, "english mk translation": "Spending time gambling will destroy ancestral wealth and honor."},{"kural number": 938, "english mk translation": "Gambling steals wealth, makes one a liar, corrupts compassion, and plunges one into suffering."},{"kural number": 939, "english mk translation": "Fame, learning, wealth, food, and clothing will abandon those addicted to gambling."},{"kural number": 940, "english mk translation": "The desire for gambling increases as wealth decreases, just as the desire for life increases as death approaches."},{"kural number": 941, "english mk translation": "Disease arises when the three humors - wind, bile, phlegm - are imbalanced."},{"kural number": 942, "english mk translation": "If one allows adequate time for digestion between meals, no other medicine is needed."},{"kural number": 943, "english mk translation": "Eating according to digestion and hunger leads to a long life."},{"kural number": 944, "english mk translation": "Eat food that suits your body only after digestion and when truly hungry."},{"kural number": 945, "english mk translation": "Even suitable food, if eaten in excess, should be avoided; moderation ensures a trouble-free life."},{"kural number": 946, "english mk translation": "Moderation in eating leads to health; excess leads to disease."},{"kural number": 947, "english mk translation": "Eating excessively without regard for hunger leads to innumerable diseases."},{"kural number": 948, "english mk translation": "One must properly investigate the cause, nature, and cure of disease (this applies to societal ills as well)."},{"kural number": 949, "english mk translation": "A physician must consider the patient's age, the nature of the disease, and the timing before administering treatment."},{"kural number": 950, "english mk translation": "The four components of medicine are: the patient, the doctor, the medicine, and the attendant."},{"kural number": 951, "english mk translation": "Only those with impartiality and quiet humility can be considered of noble birth."},{"kural number": 952, "english mk translation": "Those who do not deviate from discipline, truthfulness, and honor are considered of noble birth."},{"kural number": 953, "english mk translation": "Individuals possessing cheerfulness, generosity, sweet speech, and respect for others are considered virtuous citizens."},{"kural number": 954, "english mk translation": "Even if offered vast wealth, those born into noble families will not compromise their honor."},{"kural number": 955, "english mk translation": "Even in poverty, those born into noble families will not abandon their generosity."},{"kural number": 956, "english mk translation": "Those who believe they live virtuously will not engage in deceitful acts."},{"kural number": 957, "english mk translation": "The minor flaws of those born into noble families are as apparent as the blemishes on the moon."},{"kural number": 958, "english mk translation": "Even if one possesses beauty and fame, the absence of love casts doubt on their lineage."},{"kural number": 959, "english mk translation": "Just as the soil reveals the quality of the crop, a person's words reveal their lineage."},{"kural number": 960, "english mk translation": "Fearing blame and acting humbly towards everyone elevates one's character and lineage."},{"kural number": 961, "english mk translation": "If an action, even if necessary, compromises one's honor, it should be avoided."},{"kural number": 962, "english mk translation": "Those who desire glorious valor will not engage in dishonorable acts for fame."},{"kural number": 963, "english mk translation": "One needs humility in prosperity and self-respect when facing adversity."},{"kural number": 964, "english mk translation": "One who loses honor, even from a high position, is considered insignificant, like shed hair."},{"kural number": 965, "english mk translation": "Even those as tall as mountains will shrink if they engage in even a tiny ignoble act."},{"kural number": 966, "english mk translation": "What glory is gained by enduring insults and submitting to others, losing one's honor?"},{"kural number": 967, "english mk translation": "It is better to die than to live by submitting to those who do not respect you."},{"kural number": 968, "english mk translation": "Since there is no medicine for death, compromising honor for the sake of life is ignoble."},{"kural number": 969, "english mk translation": "Just as a deer loses its life when its fur is removed, noble people will give up their lives when their honor is threatened."},{"kural number": 970, "english mk translation": "The world will forever honor those who die to preserve their honor when faced with disgrace."},{"kural number": 971, "english mk translation": "Diligence is what gives life meaning; living without diligence is ignoble."},{"kural number": 972, "english mk translation": "All are equal by birth; differences arise from the work they do."},{"kural number": 973, "english mk translation": "Those without virtue are not noble, even in high positions; those who avoid ignoble acts are noble, even in low positions."},{"kural number": 974, "english mk translation": "One who lives with self-respect and integrity will achieve the fame and honor of chaste women."},{"kural number": 975, "english mk translation": "Those capable of accomplishing difficult tasks in the proper way are honorable."},{"kural number": 976, "english mk translation": "The desire to honor the noble is not found in those with limited intellect."},{"kural number": 977, "english mk translation": "If even a noble position is given to the base, they will naturally overstep their bounds."},{"kural number": 978, "english mk translation": "The noble always behave humbly; the base praise themselves and remain arrogant."},{"kural number": 979, "english mk translation": "Humility is greatness; arrogance is smallness."},{"kural number": 980, "english mk translation": "Concealing others' faults is greatness; dwelling on others' faults is smallness."},{"kural number": 981, "english mk translation": "Efforts made to fulfill duties with integrity are considered noble deeds."},{"kural number": 982, "english mk translation": "Virtue is the only beauty for the noble; all other beauty is insignificant."},{"kural number": 983, "english mk translation": "Love, fear of blame, adherence to worldly conduct, compassionate action, and truthfulness are the five pillars of nobility."},{"kural number": 984, "english mk translation": "Penance is based on non-killing; nobility is the virtue of not pointing out others' harm."},{"kural number": 985, "english mk translation": "Humility, not arrogance, is the strength of the powerful; it transforms enmity into friendship."},{"kural number": 986, "english mk translation": "The ability to accept defeat, even from the unequal, is the measure of one's greatness."},{"kural number": 987, "english mk translation": "What is the use of nobility if one does not refrain from harming even those who harm them?"},{"kural number": 988, "english mk translation": "Poverty is not a disgrace to one who possesses the virtue of nobility."},{"kural number": 989, "english mk translation": "The noble, who fulfill their duties with integrity, remain steadfast like the ocean, even during cosmic dissolution."},{"kural number": 990, "english mk translation": "The world will not tolerate the decline of the noble's virtue."},{"kural number": 991, "english mk translation": "Interacting humbly with everyone is the easiest way to acquire the virtue of politeness."},{"kural number": 992, "english mk translation": "Being loving and embodying the principles of noble lineage is the virtuous path."},{"kural number": 993, "english mk translation": "Those without virtue are not truly human, despite their physical form; those who avoid ignoble acts are human, even if their status is low."},{"kural number": 994, "english mk translation": "The world will praise the virtuous who rule justly and serve others."},{"kural number": 995, "english mk translation": "Even joking insults can cause harm; the wise behave virtuously even towards enemies."},{"kural number": 996, "english mk translation": "Worldly affairs should be guided by the virtuous; otherwise, they will be ruined."},{"kural number": 997, "english mk translation": "Even a brilliant scholar without virtue is like a tree."},{"kural number": 998, "english mk translation": "If one behaves virtuously towards those who are not worthy of friendship and only cause harm, it will be considered ignoble."},{"kural number": 999, "english mk translation": "For those who cannot enjoy friendship, the world is dark even during the day."},{"kural number": 1000, "english mk translation": "Just as milk spoils in a tarnished vessel, wealth possessed by the unvirtuous is useless."},{"kural number": 1001, "english mk translation": "What is the use of accumulating vast wealth driven by insatiable desire, only to die without enjoying it?"},{"kural number": 1002, "english mk translation": "One who hoards wealth without giving to anyone, believing wealth is everything, is an ignoble being."},{"kural number": 1003, "english mk translation": "Those who accumulate wealth without seeking fame are a burden to this earth."},{"kural number": 1004, "english mk translation": "What can one who is disliked by all expect to endure after their death?"},{"kural number": 1005, "english mk translation": "Even if vast wealth accumulates, it is useless if one lacks the virtue of giving."},{"kural number": 1006, "english mk translation": "One who neither enjoys their wealth nor gives to others becomes a disease clinging to their wealth."},{"kural number": 1007, "english mk translation": "The wealth of one who does not give to the poor is like a beautiful woman growing old alone."},{"kural number": 1008, "english mk translation": "Wealth accumulated by the disliked is no different from poisonous fruit on a tree in the middle of a village."},{"kural number": 1009, "english mk translation": "Wealth accumulated through greed, devoid of love, will be plundered by others."},{"kural number": 1010, "english mk translation": "Even a slight shadow of poverty befalling the truly wealthy is like the failure of rain."},{"kural number": 1011, "english mk translation": "There is a great difference between the shame one feels for their own wrongdoing and the natural modesty of virtuous women."},{"kural number": 1012, "english mk translation": "Food and clothing are common needs; but the special need is modesty, avoiding blameworthy actions."},{"kural number": 1013, "english mk translation": "Just as life is inseparable from the body, honor is inseparable from modesty."},{"kural number": 1014, "english mk translation": "The shame felt for past mistakes is an adornment for the great; without it, even prideful conduct is like a disease."},{"kural number": 1015, "english mk translation": "One who feels shame not only for their own faults but also for the faults of others is an embodiment of modesty."},{"kural number": 1016, "english mk translation": "Noble people consider modesty a greater protection than any physical security."},{"kural number": 1017, "english mk translation": "Those with modesty will sacrifice life to protect it, not vice versa."},{"kural number": 1018, "english mk translation": "If those who have incurred blame do not feel ashamed, virtue itself will depart, considering them shameless."},{"kural number": 1019, "english mk translation": "Deviating from one's principles brings disgrace to the lineage; acting blameworthily without shame leads to ruin."},{"kural number": 1020, "english mk translation": "There is no difference between a puppet controlled by strings and a person who moves through life without shame."},{"kural number": 1021, "english mk translation": "One who diligently pursues their duties without fatigue achieves the highest glory."},{"kural number": 1022, "english mk translation": "Those with deep knowledge and tireless effort will elevate their lineage."},{"kural number": 1023, "english mk translation": "The natural forces of the universe will aid those who tirelessly work to uplift their subjects."},{"kural number": 1024, "english mk translation": "Success will come naturally to those who engage diligently in actions that elevate their subjects."},{"kural number": 1025, "english mk translation": "People will embrace as their own those who are blameless and work for the welfare of the subjects."},{"kural number": 1026, "english mk translation": "A ruler skilled in governance brings glory to their lineage."},{"kural number": 1027, "english mk translation": "Just as the responsibility of leading an army rests with the capable, the responsibility of protecting and uplifting subjects rests with capable individuals."},{"kural number": 1028, "english mk translation": "If one falters when facing challenges or delays action waiting for the right time, the welfare of the subjects will be jeopardized."},{"kural number": 1029, "english mk translation": "One who strives tirelessly to protect their subjects from suffering will be hailed as born to endure hardship."},{"kural number": 1030, "english mk translation": "A community without individuals capable of enduring hardship will be overcome by it."},{"kural number": 1031, "english mk translation": "This world revolves around agriculture; therefore, farming is the greatest profession, regardless of hardship."},{"kural number": 1032, "english mk translation": "Agriculture sustains all beings by providing food, making it the pillar of the world."},{"kural number": 1033, "english mk translation": "Farmers who live by their own labor are the truly noble; others depend on them."},{"kural number": 1034, "english mk translation": "Farmers have the power to bring even ruling kings under their shade."},{"kural number": 1035, "english mk translation": "Those who earn their livelihood through their own labor do not beg, nor do they refuse those who ask."},{"kural number": 1036, "english mk translation": "Even ascetics who have renounced all attachments must depend on farmers for sustenance."},{"kural number": 1037, "english mk translation": "Plowing the land multiple times, even without manure, yields abundant crops."},{"kural number": 1038, "english mk translation": "Fertilizing is better than plowing; weeding and watering are even better; protecting the crop is the best."},{"kural number": 1039, "english mk translation": "If a farmer neglects their field daily, it will become barren like a wife who has been rejected."},{"kural number": 1040, "english mk translation": "The earth mocks those who claim there is no way to live and remain idle."},{"kural number": 1041, "english mk translation": "Poverty is the only suffering comparable to itself."},{"kural number": 1042, "english mk translation": "Poverty brings unending suffering in the present and future."},{"kural number": 1043, "english mk translation": "Poverty leading to greed destroys lineage and fame."},{"kural number": 1044, "english mk translation": "Poverty causes even the noble to utter ignoble words out of despair."},{"kural number": 1045, "english mk translation": "Various sufferings arise from the suffering of poverty."},{"kural number": 1046, "english mk translation": "Even profound knowledge is ineffective if spoken by a poor person."},{"kural number": 1047, "english mk translation": "If one deviates from virtue due to poverty, even their mother will treat them as a stranger."},{"kural number": 1048, "english mk translation": "The poor person longs for the poverty of yesterday not to return today."},{"kural number": 1049, "english mk translation": "One can sleep amidst fire, but not amidst the torment of poverty."},{"kural number": 1050, "english mk translation": "Those who remain alive without fully renouncing themselves due to poverty only harm their meager sustenance."},{"kural number": 1051, "english mk translation": "If one asks from someone capable of giving, and they refuse, the blame lies with the refuser, not the asker."},{"kural number": 1052, "english mk translation": "If a gift is received without causing distress to either giver or receiver, it brings joy, even if begged."},{"kural number": 1053, "english mk translation": "It is honorable to beg from those with open hearts and a sense of duty, even when one is poor."},{"kural number": 1054, "english mk translation": "If one does not hide what they have, begging from them is as honorable as giving."},{"kural number": 1055, "english mk translation": "The poor approach those who do not hide their wealth, as they are willing to give."},{"kural number": 1056, "english mk translation": "If those who hide their wealth and say 'I have none' are encountered, the suffering of the poor will cease."},{"kural number": 1057, "english mk translation": "When one encounters generous givers who do not scorn or mock, the hearts of the poor rejoice."},{"kural number": 1058, "english mk translation": "There is no difference between the poor who beg and puppets manipulated by strings."},{"kural number": 1059, "english mk translation": "Without beggars, the opportunity to gain fame by giving would cease."},{"kural number": 1060, "english mk translation": "If one is refused by someone who has wealth, they should not get angry; their own poverty is proof enough."},{"kural number": 1061, "english mk translation": "It is a million times more honorable not to beg, even from those who give generously."},{"kural number": 1062, "english mk translation": "If begging is the only way to live, let the creator of the world perish."},{"kural number": 1063, "english mk translation": "There is no greater cruelty than seeking to alleviate poverty by begging."},{"kural number": 1064, "english mk translation": "Even when there is no way to live, the refusal to beg is invaluable."},{"kural number": 1065, "english mk translation": "Even if one must drink thin gruel, earning it oneself is sweeter than anything else."},{"kural number": 1066, "english mk translation": "Even asking for water for a thirsty cow is more degrading than anything else."},{"kural number": 1067, "english mk translation": "I implore all beggars not to beg from those who hide their wealth and say they have none."},{"kural number": 1068, "english mk translation": "If a beggar encounters a heartless person who denies having wealth, their plea will shatter."},{"kural number": 1069, "english mk translation": "It pains the heart to think of the poor, but it is impossible to feel anything for those who hide their wealth."},{"kural number": 1070, "english mk translation": "When the poor hear the word 'no' from those who hide their wealth, their life ends. Where do the lives of those who say 'no' hide?"},{"kural number": 1071, "english mk translation": "They appear virtuous but are wicked; this duality is found only in humans."},{"kural number": 1072, "english mk translation": "In a way, the wicked who worry about nothing are luckier than those who constantly worry about good deeds."},{"kural number": 1073, "english mk translation": "Wicked people can do whatever they desire, like gods; hence, both can be considered equal."},{"kural number": 1074, "english mk translation": "The wicked, lacking virtue, feel superior when they encounter those even lower than themselves."},{"kural number": 1075, "english mk translation": "The base pretend to be virtuous when they expect benefits; otherwise, they act somewhat virtuously out of fear."},{"kural number": 1076, "english mk translation": "Wicked people who spread secrets are like the 'thudi' drum, which spreads sound."},{"kural number": 1077, "english mk translation": "The wicked, who are stingy even with their own saliva, will not give anything to the poor."},{"kural number": 1078, "english mk translation": "While the wise can obtain benefits by pointing out faults, extracting anything from the wicked requires immense struggle, like crushing sugarcane."},{"kural number": 1079, "english mk translation": "A wicked person who envies others' food and clothing will readily find fault with them."},{"kural number": 1080, "english mk translation": "The only way for the wicked to escape suffering is to sell themselves."},{"kural number": 1081, "english mk translation": "Oh, my captivating beauty! Oh, my colorful peacock! My heart is mesmerized by this maiden."},{"kural number": 1082, "english mk translation": "Facing her arrow-like eyes, as I looked at her, she looked back at me, as if attacking me with a spear was not enough, she attacked me with a companion."},{"kural number": 1083, "english mk translation": "I did not know the fearsome Yama before; now I know he is a maiden with eyes that wage war."},{"kural number": 1084, "english mk translation": "Why do the eyes of this innocent maiden, who embodies feminine grace, seem to snatch life away?"},{"kural number": 1085, "english mk translation": "Is it the eyes of death? The eyes of love? The eyes of a bewildered doe? at that moment, that slender-waisted maiden appears with a new radiance."},{"kural number": 1099, "english mk translation": "Lovers have a peculiar habit: they look at each other in public as if they were strangers."},{"kural number": 1100, "english mk translation": "When loving eyes meet and unite, words become unnecessary."},{"kural number": 1101, "english mk translation": "This beautiful maiden, adorned with bangles, possesses all five senses of pleasure: sight, sound, touch, smell, and taste."},{"kural number": 1102, "english mk translation": "There are many medicines to cure diseases, but the cure for the disease of love is the beloved herself."},{"kural number": 1103, "english mk translation": "They speak of the world of the lotus-eyed one; is it as sweet as resting on the shoulder of a loving beloved?"},{"kural number": 1104, "english mk translation": "Where did this maiden get this novel fire that burns when distant and cools when near?"},{"kural number": 1105, "english mk translation": "Just as a desired object brings pleasure whenever it appears, the arms of this flower-crowned maiden offer pleasure."},{"kural number": 1106, "english mk translation": "Perhaps the reason I feel revitalized every time I embrace this maiden is that her beautiful arms are made of nectar."},{"kural number": 1107, "english mk translation": "The joy of sharing what one has earned and eating heartily is comparable to the joy of embracing one's beautiful beloved."},{"kural number": 1108, "english mk translation": "The greatest pleasure for lovers is to embrace each other so tightly that not even the wind can pass between them."},{"kural number": 1109, "english mk translation": "Quarreling playfully and then reconciling to experience greater pleasure is the reward of a loving relationship."},{"kural number": 1110, "english mk translation": "The pleasure of embracing this mango-complexioned maiden, adorned with jewels, is like discovering new things each time."},{"kural number": 1111, "english mk translation": "I praise the softness of the 'anicham' flower, but my beloved is softer than that flower."},{"kural number": 1112, "english mk translation": "Oh heart that is captivated by flowers! If you wish to be considered equal to my beloved's face, live long and shine brightly."},{"kural number": 1119, "english mk translation": "Oh moon! If you wish to be considered equal to my beloved's face, it is better for you not to appear before many."},{"kural number": 1120, "english mk translation": "Whether 'anicham' flowers or swan feathers, both prick like thorns when touched by my beloved's feet, such is their softness."},{"kural number": 1121, "english mk translation": "The saliva that flows between the pearl-like teeth of this sweet-tongued maiden tastes like a mixture of milk and honey."},{"kural number": 1122, "english mk translation": "Life and body are inseparable; such is our union."},{"kural number": 1123, "english mk translation": "Oh, pupil of my eye!
